sentences.en: As for what would happen to theirs, I could not foretell, much less could I guarantee.
sentences.cn: 但它们各自的命运, 我是不能预知, 也不能担保的.

sentences.en: Did I not proclaim this and foretell it long ago?
sentences.cn: 我岂不是从上古就说明指示你们 吗 ?

sentences.en: Dreams often foretell many important things.
sentences.cn: “梦常常会预示许多重大的事. ”

sentences.en: I can foretell the results if we try to enter by force.
sentences.cn: 我能预言我们试图用武力进入的结果.

sentences.en: It is believed that fortune - tellers can foretell your fate.
sentences.cn: 人们相信 算命 人可以预测你的命运.

sentences.en: Peacock also is said to be able to foretell rain, and dances when rain is coming.
sentences.cn: 据说孔雀能够预知雨水, 将要下雨的时候就会跳舞.

sentences.en: She could foretell what his reaction would be.
sentences.cn: 她能预先说出他会有什么反应.

sentences.en: She could foretell what the outcome would be.
Something difficult or impossible to foretell or foresee.
sentences.cn: 要预测出谁将获胜是不可能的.

sentences.en: the birth of Christ, foretold by prophets
sentences.cn: 先知们所预言的基督的诞生

sentences.en: The outcome of the war is hard to foretell.
To their surprise, the old Indian could exactly foretell the weather.
sentences.cn: 令他们惊奇的是, 这位老印第安人可以准确地预报天气.

sentences.en: We can't foretell how the world will end.
sentences.cn: 我们不能预言世界将如何终结.

sentences.en: Who could ever foretell that Paul would turn traitor?
sentences.cn: 谁能料到保罗会变成叛徒?

sentences.en: Willow trees breaking out into buds foretell the coming of spring.
You can't foretell how the war will end.
sentences.cn: 这场战争的结局难以预料.

trans.tran_en: to say what will happen in the future, especially by using special magical powers
